text:
In a Dark Room

A cramped, dimly lit garret; Raskolnikov sulks.  
He feels trapped in his thoughts.  
Raskolnikov: “Low ceilings cramp my soul.”  

Sonia watches, concerned.  
Sonia: “You need to leave this place.”  
Raskolnikov: “I won’t. I prefer the darkness.”  

---  

Raskolnikov lies still, lost in thought.  
Dust covers his notebooks.  
Raskolnikov: “Why am I so stupid?”  

Sonia: “You’re not stupid, just lost.”  
Raskolnikov: “Men won’t change; it’s pointless.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on his isolation and the futility of waiting for others to change, concluding that true power lies in strength of mind and daring.
